dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're close on a maze of metal rods, tubes, and wires. It as we pull out that we realize it's the engine of a car. the image we hear a voice talking on a phone.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER O/S
dialogues.text: ...hundred thousand streets in this city, you don't need to know the route. You give me a time and place, I give you a five minute window. Those five minutes I'm yours. Whatever goes down I'm yours. Minute either side you're on your own...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the engine ignites and roars to life we DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A map of downtown L.A. spread out on a bed, dozens of dif routes marked in pencil. The voice continues -

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER O/S
dialogues.text: ...One last thing. You won't be able to reach me at this number again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DRIVER hangs up the phone. He folds his map of LA and sli in his duffel bag. A few clothes and other essentials are packed inside. He zips the bag shut and takes one last lo cheap TV set. On screen, a movie is playing. On a radio, Clippers are taking a pounding from the New York Knicks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver strides through a dimly lit car park, carrying his bag. A YOUNG COUPLE emerge from their car after a late ni out. Driver lowers his eyes, avoiding their gaze as he ma way towards a sleek 1970's Chevelle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Clippers-Knicks game plays on the car radio now. Driv only half listening, focused on the road. We see his face passing neon lights. Feline good looks. Impassive blue ey Something almost melancholy in his unwavering gaze. He dr carefully, letting other cars overtake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver glides into the parking lot of another low-rent ap block. 2 9/24/10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clutching his duffel bag Driver heads towards the car par elevator. Hurrying out in the opposite direction he sees pretty GIRL in her 20's wearing a waitress outfit. Their meet briefly, before Driver walks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver heads down the hallway and unlocks the door to his apartment. It's not all that different from his last one. sparse, and anonymous. He doesn't even bother to walk in. tosses his duffel bag inside and locks the door again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver's back on the road, the basketball game still play the radio. He drives past a row of brightly lit Mexican f shacks on Silver Lake Boulevard and turns into a run down lit up with a neon sign - Shannon's Picture Car Warehouse vintage cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHANNON, the owner of the garage, has a distinctive limp. follows him past rows of vintage cars.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Plain Jane cheap like you asked for but with a hundred and sixty horsepower inside. You get any sleep?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not this week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Shannon grins we feel the familiarity between them.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can offer you some Halcyon.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head past more cars -- Fords, Dodges, Buicks -- unti arrive at a plain looking Impala.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There she is. Silver Impala. Most popular car in the state of California...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver casts his eyes over the unimpressive vehicle then out his hand for the keys. 3 9/24/10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The basketball game is approaching the end of the third q Driver's behind the wheel of the Impala now, cruising pas of dingy toy stores on 3rd Street. He glances at his watc 9:50. He checks his mirror then turns into a side street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vast electronics superstore dominates the deserted stre Under the pale yellow glow of the street lamps, Driver se signs advertising a `huge blow out weekend sale'. He pull making sure he has a good view of the entrance. On the ra the basketball commentator is getting more excited.  BASKETBALL COMMENTARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...This is some comeback from the Clippers! Only a few minutes ago they looked dead and buried!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver reaches under the seat and pulls out a small handh scanner. He switches it on, tuning it to the right freque Crackling police dispatches are interspersed with the bas commentary now.  POLICE SCANNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...9 Adam 81, what is your current location?...Repeat, what is your current location?...  BASKETBALL COMMENTARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Another unbelievable three pointer from Davis and the Clippers are within five!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the corner of his eye Driver sees two MEN approach doesn't react, expecting them. They cut through the fence bolt cutters and approach the main building. Driver watch pull on their masks, then one of them takes out a shotgun blasts the lock to the front door. Instantly the alarm sh The only thing Driver does is to turn on his stop watch.  BASKETBALL COMMENTARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Time out Knicks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stop watching keeps ticking away, the siren blaring, commentary continuing, the police scanner crackling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storefront is hidden in shadow, impossible to tell wh going on inside. Driver looks at his stop watch. Almost t minutes. One of the masked men emerges now, carrying a du bag. He hurries over and gets in the back of Driver's car without a word. There's no sign of the other robber.    (CONTINUED) 4 9/24/10 11 CONTINUED: 11

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The commentary continues, so does the crackling on the po scanner. Four minutes. Still no sign of the second armed His companion in the back starts to look nervous, wonderi what's happened to his partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver doesn't betray a hint of nerves. Four and half min his stop watch. Thirty seconds more and he's on his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the second robber appears from the shadows, runn fast as he can to the getaway car. He jumps into the back few seconds short of five minutes and Driver screeches of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver thunders over the 1st Street bridge towards Boyle Heights, then eases his foot off the gas, slowing to a st speed. In the back seat the two armed robbers rip off the masks, looking pumped up with adrenalin. Driver studies t his rear view mirror, then swerves right on Mission Stree his police scanner crackles to life.  POLICE SCANNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Attention all units...211...Superstore on Traction Avenue...Suspects headed Eastbound on 1st Street...Driving a Silver Impala...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver swings sharply into 4th Street now, crossing the L River again, heading back in the same direction he came.  POLICE SCANNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Airships dispatched...Downtown and Boyle Heights...All units standby. Repeat, all units standby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up ahead, the lights of Downtown L.A. glitter against the sky. Hovering between the neon green glow of the skyscrap Driver sees the red and white glint of a police helicopte switches off his headlights, turning left on Santa Fe Ave

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The armed robbers watch in tense silence as Driver weaves out of the industrial alleyways with his lights switched It's as if he's trying to find his way out of the maze or probing to see if there's anyone out there.  POLICE SCANNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...1 Baker 11, headed south on Boyle Avenue...No sign of suspects...Repeat, no sign of suspects...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The armed robbers look relieved when suddenly a police ca glides past at the end of the alleyway, its lights also o  (CONTINUED) 5 9/24/10 13 CONTINUED: 13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like catching a glimpse of a passing shark's fin. Dr taps the brakes gently, his car sliding to a stop. He sta there a moment, then eases the Impala forward, turning in same direction as the black-and-white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a high-risk strategy but Driver follows the black-an at a distance, hidden in the darkness, knowing other squa won't be checking the same route. The police car makes it through the dimly lit industrial zone, unaware it's being shadowed. Driver turns his car radio up a whisper.  BASKETBALL COMMENTARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And for the first time in the game the Clippers have the lead. 71 to 69. Seven to go in the Fourth here at the Staples Centre...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver turns the sound back down. Up ahead, the police ca swings left, disappearing from view. Driver slows down to anticipating the next obstacle. He doesn't have long to w the distance he suddenly sees the piercing beam of a poli chopper's search-lights, sweeping the area one more time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver floors the gas, speeding straight towards the appr helicopter. The armed robbers are too stunned to protest. just sit there, watching the sweeping searchlights gettin closer and closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then suddenly it becomes clear what Driver's doing. Up ah there's a small underpass below the 7th Street bridge. Dr slides the car under the safety of the bridge just before chopper's searchlights spot them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roar of the helicopter thunders overhead. The underpa crammed with dirty mattresses and shopping carts. Sleepin can be seen under dirty blankets. Driver waits for the ec the helicopter to fade, then moves forward again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloomy yellow street-lamps shine down on the industrial z Rows of delivery trucks are parked outside the meat-packi factories. Driver cruises cautiously down the deserted st The crackling of the police scanner and the droning of th basketball commentary add to the tension. Finally up ahea sees car-lights streaming back and forth on Broadway.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down...   (CONTINUED) 6 9/24/10 16 CONTINUED: 16

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The armed robbers lie flat on the back seat, paying Drive respect now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a steady flow of traffic on Broadway. Driver fall behind the other cars. On the radio, the basketball game still playing.  BASKETBALL COMMENTARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Three thirteen left on the clock. Dunleavy calls a time out and it's the Clippers by one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The passing head-lamps light up Driver's face. There's no trace of emotion in his eyes -- even when he spots a patr approaching in the opposite direction.  BASKETBALL COMMENTARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Buckle up your seat belts Clippers fans. This game really is too close to call...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two cars pass each other slowly. Driver sees the cops Black-and-White peering at the Impala as they head past. turns down the basketball game and focuses on the scanner  POLICE SCANNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...This is 1 David 16...Silver Impala headed South on Broadway and Pico...Couldn't get a look at her license plates...Appears to be only one occupant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the back seat, the armed robbers wait nervously for th police dispatch to respond.  POLICE SCANNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...1 David 16...why don't you check her out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as he hears this Driver swerves sharply into the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver guns around the block now, building up speed.  POLICE SCANNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...This is 1 David 16...We lost the suspect somewhere between Broadway and Grand...Possible evasive action...Request airship and additional units... 7 9/24/10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver bursts out onto Pico now. A squad car headed in th opposite direction slows down as it sees him but is caugh the flow of traffic, unable to turn round and give chase.  POLICE SCANNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...1 David 11...suspect headed West on Pico...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver threads his way through the vehicles in front of h smooth and effortless it's hard to tell how fast he's goi glances up as he hears the dull rumble of a police choppe overhead. The helicopter is almost directly above him, sw its search-beam back and forth to get a lock on his posit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver pushes the car as fast as it will go, but there's of outrunning the chopper. Blue light floods the asphalt him as he guns down Figueroa.  POLICE SCANNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All units...pursuit in progress...silver Impala...Headed North on Figueroa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even now Driver doesn't panic, turning his attention back basketball game.  BASKETBALL COMMENTARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thornton pulls up from behind the arc, misses. Rebound New York. One eighteen to play...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver swerves sharply towards the sparkling lights of th Staples Centre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The terraced parking lot looms up ahead. A sign above the barrier says `Season Ticket Holders Only'. Driver punches ticket and roars into the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Impala screeches from one level to the next. With a g going on, the parking lot is almost full. Finally Driver into a free parking space.  BASKETBALL COMMENTARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Thirty seconds remaining and all the Knicks have to do is run out the clock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver glances in his side mirror. Behind him, dozens of are already streaming out into the parking lot before the is over, hoping to avoid the inevitable traffic.  (CONTINUED) 8 9/24/10 21 CONTINUED: 21  BASKETBALL COMMENTARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Gordon back to Davis...Davis for three...This is unbelievable!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jubilant commentary continues, but Driver isn't liste anymore. The game has served its purpose. More fans flood the parking lot. Dozens of cars pull out of their places.  BASKETBALL COMMENTARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What a remarkable comeback...Outplayed for most of the game, the Clippers have shown incredible resilience...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver glances at the armed robbers and nods. It's time. climb out of the car, merging in with the crowd. Driver w them disappear, then slips on a Clippers cap, climbs out Impala himself and heads towards another car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the parking lot, the police are waiting, stopping anything that looks like an Impala, shining their flashli into the windows. Wearing his Clippers cap and a Clippers sticker on his new car, Driver calmly drives past them, m his getaway.  DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver's face is fixed ahead, sunglasses hiding his eyes. PULL OUT we see to our surprise that he's wearing a polic uniform. It's only as we pull out further that we see sev other `POLICE OFFICERS' sitting in the same fold up chair reading car magazines and scripts as they're powdered by GIRLS, and realize we're on a movie set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver glances up from his script and sees another STUNTM being fitted with an SFX mask. The stuntman now looks ide to the STAR of the movie who stands nearby.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT DIRECTOR O/S
dialogues.text: I need you guys to sign this contract...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver takes the form along with all the other stuntmen a signs it without a glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon is discussing a car stunt with another AD, using cars on the hood of a cop car to demonstrate the danger.     (CONTINUED) 9 9/24/10 24 CONTINUED: 24  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...This is a whole new thing. He taps the fender any faster than fifty not only will she roll, she'll roll all the way to Baja.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver heads off, disinterested in the negotiations.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A high risk stunt like that's worth at least a thousand five.  AD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't go higher than a thousand.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For all his charm we sense something of the hustler about Shannon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver approaches a buffet table laid out with food. He's to help himself when JACK, the caterer, stops him.  JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, that's for the director...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver sits at the wheel of the Black-and-White while a S SUPERVISOR checks his harness. Shannon leans into the win with a smile.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I managed to get them up to five hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver doesn't seem to care, focussed on the job.

dialogues.speaker: 2ND UNIT DIRECTOR O/S
dialogues.text: Camera ready, sound ready...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon joins the rest of the crew, looking on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver floors the gas, screeching out of the alleyway. He swerves between several oil drums then straightens up on main road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his rear view mirror he sees a black Dodge Charger app cue, bearing down on him.   (CONTINUED) 10 9/24/10 26 CONTINUED: 26

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver slows to forty, like he's supposed to, but the bla Charger keeps coming at speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver's eyes stay fixed on his rear view mirror, judging other car's speed and angle of approach to perfection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Charger slams into the back of Driver's car at sixty an hour, hitting him just above the left rear wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver's reactions are quick as lightning, counter-steeri his Black-and-White goes careening off the road. He keeps car upright long enough to slow it down before it finally end over end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up ahead, the Charger skids to a showy stop.

dialogues.speaker: 2ND UNIT DIRECTOR O/S
dialogues.text: ...And CUT!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some clapping and cheering breaks out, but most the crew couldn't care less, returning to their cell-phones and sh lists. Only Shannon seems interested in Driver, limping o helping him out of his battered Black-and-White.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice work, officer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver spits out some fake candyglass from the shattered windscreen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A New York style pizza-by-the-slice restaurant. A WAITER delivery of Chinese food at the door and carries it over table where Shannon is sitting with an old friend, BERNIE  WAITER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go, Mr. Rose. (Taking out the white boxes) Egg rolls, chicken chow mein, five flavor shrimp and Peking duck.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they remember the chop sticks?  WAITER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't look like it, sir. Let me run and get the guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the way the waiter hurries off we get a sense of Ber power and authority. He turns back to Shannon, resuming t conversation.    (CONTINUED) 11 9/24/10 27 CONTINUED: 27  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You run a perfectly good business. Why would you want to change now?  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how much my business made last year? Thirty Grand. Takes me six months to build a car and a couple of seconds for these jerks to write it off on a stunt that doesn't even make it into the movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie shakes his head but clearly has a soft spot for Sh  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much do you need?  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me talk you through it first.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds like a lot.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't have to be. The big money teams burn through three, four million a year but that's `cause they're using half a dozen test drivers and a stable of cars.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know anything about car racing but I assume there's a reason for that?  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, but it's not the only way. All I need is a hard-used stock car. We start off with the small-town action then work our way up. There's close to two thousand events out there and once we make the Show we're talking millions.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Millions'?  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a fortune to be made. Sponsorship. TV deals. We'll even name the team after you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie looks at his friend in mild exasperation then turn as the waiter returns with a handful of chop sticks.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Ron. You sure you don't want any of this?  (CONTINUED) 12 9/24/10 27 CONTINUED: (2) 27  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie waits for the waiter to leave then continues.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still haven't given me a number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon hesitates but only for a second.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four hundred and thirty thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie Rose can't help grinning at his nerve.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I wouldn't come to you unless I was sure about this.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Shannon. How can you be sure? What have you got these big money teams don't have?  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a driver.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they got half a dozen Drivers you told me.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not like this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at his friend with quiet conviction.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I been working with this guy a long time - I've never seen anything like it. I had the money I'd back him myself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie Rose considers him quietly.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you don't have the money.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything I own is in metal. I had to sell my Bullit car the other day just to pay the gas bill. I'm telling you, Bernie, put this kid behind a wheel there's nothing he can't do.    (CONTINUED) 13 9/24/10 27 CONTINUED: (3) 27  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what happens to my money if this kid gets hit by a bus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon's about to reply when they're interrupted by a bi of a man with a gruff voice.  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing eating Chink food in my restaurant?  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a Jew doing running a Pizzeria? Worst fucking pizza in LA by the way. How hard is it to bake a loaf of bread?  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the fucking water in this city...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon smiles, intimidated by Nino, giving up his seat respectfully. Nino doesn't even acknowledge him.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were supposed to be out of town anyway?  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm back. (Barely a glance at Shannon) Take a hike. I need to talk to my partner.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be polite, Nino. I invited him here.  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry. How you doing, Shannon? How's the fucking leg?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie senses things are only going to get worse and dism Shannon gently.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll think about it but I want to meet your guy first...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver stands in the elevator as it climbs slowly. It rea the ground floor then the doors slide open. Driver finds face to face with the pretty girl he saw the other night. looks a little startled to see him, then recovers

dialogues.speaker: PRETTY GIRL, (IRENE)
dialogues.text: Hi...  (CONTINUED) 14 9/24/10 28 CONTINUED: 28

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She joins him in the elevator, carrying a grocery bag wit milk and Fruit Loops cereal.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which floor, ma'am?...  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourth please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver presses the fourth floor button even though it's a lit. The doors shut and the elevator starts to climb. Dri stares out quietly. Irene takes a glance at him, feeling in the silence. She looks relieved as the elevator doors open. Driver steps aside to let her out first.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver and Irene walk down the corridor in the same direc only a few feet apart. She seems more aware of his presen he is of hers. She reaches the door to her apartment firs  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye...  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, ma'am...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver looks at her just long enough not to seem impolite continues down the corridor, not even glancing back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bright sunlight. In the distance we see a trail of dust m across the flatland. Everything is silent, then slowly th of an engine rises as the stock car turns towards us. It shimmers in the heat waves, the noise of its engine getti louder as it picks up speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon stands with his friend Bernie Rose at the edge of makeshift track, staring at the glittering car with its c signage advertising everything from Snickers to Cheerios.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like a chocolate bar. You're gonna have to tell me if that's fast or slow `cause I got no idea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon smiles to himself.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't slow... 15 9/24/10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even in the cramped space of the roll cage there's someth effortless about the way Driver controls the car. His eye fixed in concentration, his body tensing only slightly as lifts his foot off the gas and turns the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The glinting vehicle is lost in a cloud of dust, then rea again, moving even faster now. The STOCK CAR'S OWNER, a b hot-rodder with a t-shirt that says, "Drive it like you s it", joins Shannon with a confident smile.

dialogues.speaker: STOCK CAR OWNER
dialogues.text: Told you she was a beauty...  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Playing hard to get) Maybe where you come from...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie Rose pays no attention to their banter, his eyes f thoughtfully on the stock car as it finally slows to a st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver climbs out of the car. As he looks up he sees Shan limping over with the stock car's owner, a couple of MECH and Bernie Rose.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks a little long in the tooth to me. Think we should take her home?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver shrugs. Shannon grins, turning to Bernie now.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie, this is the driver I been telling you about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One look at Bernie Rose and Driver senses the power and authority behind his deceptively gentle eyes.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie's thinking of investing in our race team...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old mobster holds out his hand, meeting Driver's gaze  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My hands are a little dirty.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. So are mine...  (CONTINUED) 16 9/24/10 33 CONTINUED: 33

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives Driver a big grin and a warm handshake, sizing h Driver smiles politely, gazing back at him. The stock car owner interrupts the moment between them, holding a stopw

dialogues.speaker: STOCK CAR OWNER
dialogues.text: Couldn't see much wrong with that. You beat the fastest lap by more than half a second.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might wanna take a look at the suspension before we go again. (Turning back to Bernie) Nice to meet you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie's still studying him.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes stay on each other, then Driver follows the st owner and his mechanics back to the car. Bernie Rose star after him quietly, thinking to himself. Shannon can feel getting interested.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna give me the four?  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you three for seventy percent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tinny supermarket music plays in the background. Driver w past the vast selection of instant coffee brands, bemused choice. Suddenly he notices something out of the corner o eye. At the far end of the aisle his pretty neighbor, Ire browsing through the confectionery section. Standing next is a young boy of six or seven, (BENICIO). He grabs a mul of snickers and puts it in Irene's shopping basket. Irene picks it out, replaces it on the shelf, and takes a singl snicker bar for him instead. As Driver watches them, the turns around and notices him. Driver heads down another a before Irene sees him too, keeping to himself to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver heads out of the supermarket with a small bag of groceries when he spots Irene and Benicio again in the ca Irene sits in a battered Oldsmobile, trying to start the She tries several times then gets out in frustration, ope the hood and peering at the engine she has no idea how to Benicio peers in too, trying to be helpful.    (CONTINUED) 17 9/24/10 35 CONTINUED: 35

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver hesitates, all his instincts telling him to contin his car and drive away, but as he feels Irene's increasin frustration he can't help himself, finally heading over t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene looks over and sees him coming, surprised at first, smiling. We watch from a distance as they talk now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 35a INT. ELEVATOR/ APARTMENT BLOCK/ ECHO PARK - DAY. 35a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver, Irene and Benicio stand in silence in the elevato Driver clutching some of Irene's grocery bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver carries Irene's grocery bags into the kitchen for  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you want me to put them?  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just over there. Thanks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver places the bags on the kitchen counter.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like something to drink?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glass of water?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pours him a glass of water and hands it to him.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me a second...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks out of the room, leaving Driver alone with Beni The little boy stares at him fixedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 36a INT. BATHROOM/ IRENE'S APARTMENT - DAY. 36a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene closes the bathroom door behind her, looking at her the mirror, feeling a little uncertain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benicio's still staring at Driver. Feeling a little awkwa Driver takes a long piece of string from his pocket, tugs gently, then holds up two pieces of string.  (CONTINUED) 18 9/24/10 37 CONTINUED: 37

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benicio keeps staring at him, puzzled by the magic trick. walks back into the room, smiling.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just move to LA?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I been here a while.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And before that?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here and there...  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (A gentle smile) Too many questions, huh?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver smiles back awkwardly, not sure how else to respon Irene switches on the TV for Benicio, sitting him down on couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver has a sip of water, glancing around the room. He n a few photographs on a side table. Most of them are of Be and Irene, but one of them shows the little boy standing a strikingly handsome Latino man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene turns around and sees him looking at the picture.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Benicio's father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver takes in the significance of this, then looks back her.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he do?  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in jail.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Changing the subject) What do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver hesitates.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I drive.   (CONTINUED) 19 9/24/10 37 CONTINUED: (2) 37  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a limo driver?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, for the movies...  IRENE (INCREDULOUSLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean all those car chases and stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods, a little embarrassed.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that dangerous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seems thrown by her concern.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just part-time. Most days I work in a garage.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reseda Boulevard.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should tell Benicio you're a stunt guy.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He interested in that kind of stuff?  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't all little boys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles softly and he realizes she's teasing him.

dialogues.speaker: BENICIO O/S
dialogues.text: Mama, I don't like this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene takes the remote and changes the channel for him. D watches her quietly, then drains his glass of water.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like another glass?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should get going...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He catches the disappointment in her eyes, but she covers with another good humored smile.    (CONTINUED) 20 9/24/10 37 CONTINUED: (3) 37  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thank you for your help.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for the drink...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes his empty glass and walks him to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passing traffic roars by on the busy street. Irene and Be are walking home from the bus stop, chatting happily. The like they've just come back from the beach, Irene carryin basket full of towels, Benicio clutching a dusty soccer b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver watches them from the window of his apartment, blo gently on a cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reflection of passing neon rolls down the Camaro's windscreen. Driver's cruising down Hollywood Boulevard, s from the world outside, listening to `Purple Rain'. The H and HIPSTERS have taken over the streets while up above airbrushed movie stars stare down from their lofty billbo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's early morning and Driver's been driving all night, u to sleep. He heads across the parking lot towards a garis mini-mall. Up ahead a small group of GANGBANGERS are hang with intent. They see him coming and look over intimidati Driver's only reaction is to bunch his car keys in his ha longest key sliding between his second and third fingers weapon. The gangbangers don't see it but the unflinching his eyes unnerves them and they look away, letting him pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jukebox music plays in the bar and grill. Driver sits on own, working his way through a plate of bacon and eggs.

dialogues.speaker: BEARDED REDNECK OFFSCREEN
dialogues.text: Mind if I cut in?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver looks up and sees a burly REDNECK with an unkempt and a wrestler's physique. The redneck slides into the se opposite him.  BEARDED REDNECK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Shannon's buddy, right? We met last year. You drove me and my brother back from Palm Springs...   (CONTINUED) 21 9/24/10 41 CONTINUED: 41

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver stares into the redneck's coked-up eyes, then look down at his food.  BEARDED REDNECK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next run we hired another wheelman - I spent six months in jail, my brother got himself killed... (He grins through yellowing teeth) He wasn't much, mind you, just family...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver doesn't seem to hear him.  BEARDED REDNECK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thing is -  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not interested...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver looks up quietly, fixing him with his icy gaze. Th Redneck's smile slowly fades. He considers his response f moment, then decides against it, standing up.  BEARDED REDNECK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's good to see you again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver carries on eating as if the man didn't exist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The loud stutter of an unhealthy engine. Shannon sits in second hand race car he bought in Montecito, revving the  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like a goddamn M-16...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver smiles, popping the hood. As Shannon limps out of vehicle he sees a battered Oldsmobile drive into the fore He takes one look at the owner, then runs his hand throug white hair, breaking into a friendly smile.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gorgeous day just got even nicer. How can I help you, ma'am?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE O/S
dialogues.text: I've got a problem with my car.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON O/S
dialogues.text: I can imagine. That thing must be older than I am...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver turns around in surprise now, recognizing Irene's    (CONTINUED) 22 9/24/10 42 CONTINUED: 42  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi...  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mischievous smile lights up Shannon's face as he watche  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You boys and girls know each other?  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're neighbors.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver ignores the sly look in the old man's eyes.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what seems to be the problem, ma'am?  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either it doesn't start or it stalls.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, why don't we park her over there and take a look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver is still watching Irene quietly.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can come back later if you're busy...  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's busy, I'm not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon gives Driver another sly look as he takes her car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Oldsmobile's engine looks like it hasn't been service years. Shannon is bent over the hood.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Just my opinion, but I think you should consider buying a new car...  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (With gentle irony) That would be great...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances round and sees Benicio standing in the foreco with Driver, watching him work on his own car now.  (CONTINUED) 23 9/24/10 43 CONTINUED: 43

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver's so busy tuning the engine he hardly notices the His lack of interest finally gets a rise out of Benicio.  BENICIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That thing doesn't work.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Without looking round) You think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benicio watches him sullenly, more intrigued than he lets  BENICIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drive it.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Get in the car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benicio considers a moment, then turns and calls out to I  BENICIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama, can I go in the car?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene looks over in surprise, not sure what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver and Benicio sit in the Chevelle, driving in silenc  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mom said you like movies?  BENICIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever see the Terminator?  BENICIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grease?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benicio shakes his head.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna see where it was shot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon's got his tool kit out, examining the Olds. Irene at the forecourt but there's no sign of Driver and her so   (CONTINUED) 24 9/24/10 45 CONTINUED: 45  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long has he been working for you?  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, ma'am, your son'll be fine.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean it like that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon smiles to himself, sensing her interest in Driver  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We been together about five years now. He showed up out of the blue one day, no references or nothin', asking me for a job. I offered him half the wages I normally pay and he didn't even blink. Been exploiting him ever since... (HE GRINS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only thing he knows is cars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car roars along the drainage canals. In the passenger Benicio looks tense but exhilarated. The car glides past landscape of abandoned shopping carts, garbage bags, and shredded tires, picking up speed all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver's parked the car now in an area of the drainage ca which looks like an oasis. He leans against the vehicle, rock playing on his radio as he watches Benicio climb a t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benicio is asleep in the back of Driver's car now. Driver giving him and Irene a ride back to their apartment. Iren at Driver, waiting for him to say something, but he keeps eyes fixed on the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cradling the sleeping Benicio in his arms Driver lays him on his bed. Irene takes off her son's clothes and puts on pyjamas, careful not to wake him. Driver slips out of the uncomfortable with the intimate moment between mother and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene walks out of the bedroom, smiling at Driver gratefu  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for today. He had a great time...  (CONTINUED) 25 9/24/10 50 CONTINUED: 50  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares back at her in the silence, both of them lookin little uncertain.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry if I put you on the spot, you know, just showing up like that...  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes stay on each other, the attraction palpable. D finally breaks the tension, making a tentative move towar door. Irene opens it for him, looking up into his eyes. D knows he could kiss her, wants to, but something inside h him back. Instead he just offers his help.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need a ride anywhere over the weekend I'm not doing much...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 50a INT. DENTISTS/ NORTH HOLLYWOOD - DAY. 50a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benicio sits in a dentist's chair, looking nervous. Irene beside him, mimicking his expression, trying to make him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene emerges with Benicio from the dentists. The little clutching his mouth, making a show of being in pain. Iren teases him gently as they walk. Driver waits for them in car, watching them quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soft rock plays on the car radio. Irene sits in the passe seat with a smile. Driver looks at her curiously as he dr no idea why she's grinning. Benicio suddenly leans forwar changes the radio to a different station -- hard rock bla out. Driver lets it go for a moment, then changes it back Benicio responds, until it becomes a game, Irene laughing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roar of machinery. We see quick shots of Driver's day garage -- fixing cars, taking out some fruit he's left to in his tool box for lunch, working on more engines and fr At the end of the day Driver and Shannon examine the stoc  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I still can't believe I bought this piece of shit...  (CONTINUED) 26 9/24/10 53 CONTINUED: 53

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grins, looking at Driver.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought maybe we'd take her for a run Thursday or Friday.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't make Friday.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Why's that?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told Irene I'd drive her to Burbank.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene, huh? (TEASING HIM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're seeing quite a lot of the young lady.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're taking a long time to fix her car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the TV, a Japanese cartoon is playing, a masked hero confronting the villains, the screen flickering from colo black and white. Driver and Benicio sit on the couch, wat the cartoon. From their relaxed body language it's clear time has passed and they know each other a little better.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening now?  BENICIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's telling him if he doesn't leave the earth alone he'll fight him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene calls out from her bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: IRENE O/S
dialogues.text: I'm almost ready...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver looks back at the screen. Werewolves appear now, surrounding the hero.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like he's in trouble.  BENICIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as the fight begins the color on the TV screen flick  (CONTINUED) 27 9/24/10 54 CONTINUED: 54  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna show you another trick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benicio watches curiously as Driver gets off the couch an kneels beside the TV.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is pretty complicated. You watching?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benicio nods. Driver suddenly gives the TV set a hard sma the interference stops.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think you can remember that?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benicio grins. Driver smiles back then looks away as he h the phone ring. Irene walks out of her bedroom, dressed i waitress's uniform, and answers it.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?...Yes?...Yes, this is she...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver sees the look of surprise on Irene's face as she l to the voice on the other end. The doorbell suddenly ring Irene catches Driver's eye and asks him to open it. He he over, checks the spy-hole, then opens the door. A YOUNG W who's sitting for Benicio walks in, looking at Driver cur

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN, (IRENE'S FRIEND)
dialogues.text: Hi...  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...  BENICIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Cindy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene's friend heads past Driver and scolds Benicio affectionately.  IRENE'S FRIEND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's 8:30. Teeth. Pyjamas. TV off.  BENICIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not the TV. It's a DVD...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver looks back at Irene now. She puts down the phone, a smile but still looking distracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene sits next to Driver in the passenger seat, staring the window at the glittering fountain in Echo Park.   (CONTINUED) 28 9/24/10 55 CONTINUED: 55  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never come this way before...  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a short cut...  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The park looks pretty at night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Driver, watching him quietly, then looks awa again.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene takes a long time to answer, still staring out of t window.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was my husband's lawyer on the phone. He's getting an early release...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to sound casual. Driver takes the news quietly, though it hits him like a sledgehammer.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great...  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm happy for Benicio...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver knows she's trying to explain herself but doesn't anything, driving in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up ahead the traffic lights turn red and the car slows to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside, the silence is unbearable. Irene pauses, then loo Driver. He's even more handsome in the shadowy half-light something achingly lonely and melancholy about his stilln

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hesitates, then moves her hand towards his, brushing back of his hand, then slipping her fingers between his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gesture is tiny but charged with emotion. They both s out in silence, fingers clasped, then Irene gently withdr hand, as if nothing's happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the lights change to green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of laughter. A sign over the door says, Welcome Dad. Inside the apartment there's a small party going on.  (CONTINUED) 29 9/24/10 56 CONTINUED: 56

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene's husband, STANDARD, has been released from jail an FRIENDS and FAMILY are here to celebrate. Holding Benicio arms he makes a thank you speech to his guests.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'm touched and grateful that you're all here today -- even though I know it's probably for the food not me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His self-deprecating humor gets a chorus of laughter and agreement from the guests. Irene is standing next to her Cindy, looking a little uncomfortable.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Anyhow, now that I've completed my MBA in catering from Chino Business School... (MORE LAUGHTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene, Benicio and I are finally going to get our lives back together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises his glass to her.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to thank my wife for being the smartest, most beautiful, most patient and loyal woman I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More applause. Irene stares back at Standard's handsome f feeling even more uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver lies on his bed, gazing up at the ceiling, listeni the sound of the party echoing down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nighttime and the party's getting louder. Standard's phone to someone, trying to hear them over the music.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I can't hear you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads into the bedroom to take the call. The voice on other end is accented and unfriendly.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE ON THE PHONE
dialogues.text: Can you hear me now, you cunt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard pauses, looking concerned.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.   (CONTINUED) 30 9/24/10 58 CONTINUED: 58

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE ON THE PHONE
dialogues.text: You're gonna come see me tomorrow, you understand?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the crowded room, Irene is looking for Standard. S him in the bedroom, switching off his phone, and heads ov  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benicio wants you to put him to bed.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives her a warm smile.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that on the phone?  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My parole officer. He thinks he may have found me a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The noise of the party is finally too much for Driver. He off the bed and slips on his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene is finding the party overwhelming too. She heads ou the corridor to have a cigarette when she sees Driver acr hallway, locking the door to his own apartment. She hesit then calls out.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns around and sees her standing there with a smile.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about the noise. I was going to leave a note under your door warning you we were having a party.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I won't complain.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you would. Maybe the cops'd show up and send everybody home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes stay on each other, the music pounding in the background.   (CONTINUED) 31 9/24/10 60 CONTINUED: 60  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car works great by the way. Hasn't stalled once.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another awkward silence, so much she wants to say but can  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, if you're hungry we got plenty of FOOD -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly she turns around as she hears her apartment door Standard stands there with Benicio, holding a bag of tras pauses, then smiles.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought if we emptied the trash everyone would get the message and go home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grins at his wife, then looks over at Driver, his smil hiding whatever he feels inside.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the new neighbor, right? Benicio's told me all about you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver seems unsure how to respond.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a great kid.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't take any of the credit. He's got a great mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard rests his hand gently on Benicio's head, still s at Driver.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tells me you drive for the movies?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be pretty good?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get by.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not like a nine to five gig, huh?...  (CONTINUED) 32 9/24/10 60 CONTINUED: (2) 60

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still smiling but there's a slight edge to his voice looks uncomfortable.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to take that?  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes are still fixed on Driver.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to come in, join us for a drink?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got some things to do.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this hour of night?  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard, he's busy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard doesn't respond, still holding Driver's gaze.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if we're still going by the time you're back you know where we are. It's good to meet you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slips his arm around his son now and continues down th corridor, brushing past Driver on his way to empty the tr Driver looks at Irene, then heads off in the same directi Standard and Benicio to take the elevator. The two men st there in charged silence, one emptying the trash, the oth waiting for the elevator, only Benicio oblivious to the t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brooding movie stars look down from the billboards. Drive his car now, soft rock playing on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard is helping his son get ready for school, interac with him affectionately. Irene watches them from the door looking thoughtful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anonymous streets roll by, Driver's eyes fixed on the roa 33 9/24/10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard, Irene and Benicio are having dinner at a Chuck Cheese restaurant. We still sense the distance between St and Irene, but Benicio seems completely unaware of it, ta excitedly as he eats his pizza. Standard reaches out and Irene's hand gently as he listens to his son.  65 OMITTED 65

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A noise of hammering and drills. The corporate signage ha scraped off the race car and the seats ripped out. Bernie has bought his partner Nino to the garage to take a look investment.  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...We paid three hundred fucking grand for this?  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I paid for it. Out of my own pocket. Anyway, that's just the shell. You start with the shell, then you build the frame, then the motor. (Pointing to an engine nearby) I paid three hundred for that. The money goes on the inside not the outside.  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck that. If I'm gonna blow three hundred I wanna make sure everyone can see it. Go waste your money on something else...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon smiles nervously, worried Nino's going to sabotag deal with Bernie.  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pointing to a Thunderbird) ...How about that fucking pussy mobile over there.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You buy it. Shannon sell him the car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the far end of the garage Driver hears them laughing, busy working on his car to pay any attention. Shannon ope door of the Thunderbird and invites Nino to take a seat.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try her out. She's more comfortable than a water bed.   (CONTINUED) 34 9/24/10 66 CONTINUED: 66  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already got a fucking water bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits heavily in the car and starts prodding and pressi the control buttons as if he wants to break them.  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does this fucking thing do?  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Windshield wipers.  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about this little clit? I don't know whether to fuck it or drive it. Fuck it, I'll drive it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie Rose shakes his head at his partner's foul languag looks away, observing Driver quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver applies a blow torch to his car, so absorbed in hi he doesn't hear Bernie Rose approach.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE ROSE O/S
dialogues.text: How you doing?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver hears him and turns off the blow torch, standing u respectfully. Bernie Rose gives him a friendly smile.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, when's our first race?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna be ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something gently challenging in his gaze.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope so...  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cautious man. Like myself. Don't wanna make promises you can't keep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver smiles but doesn't respond. Bernie Rose finds him to talk to as everyone else. Across the garage, Nino sits T-Bird with Shannon, still fucking with him. Bernie watch them.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ever tell you how we met?  (CONTINUED) 35 9/24/10 66 CONTINUED: (2) 66

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver shakes his head.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did some producing back in the 80's. Interesting pictures. Kind of European. Shannon arranged the cars for us and did all the stunts. I knew he was overcharging me but I loved having him around. His next business venture he tried the same thing with some of Nino's friends they broke his spine. He never had much luck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's about to continue when they're interrupted by a fami voice.

dialogues.speaker: STANDARD O/S
dialogues.text: Hey!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver turns around and sees Irene's husband, Standard, h towards him with a confident smile.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a minute? I want to -  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're talking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie Rose barely raises his voice but it's full of quie menace and authority. Standard pauses, stung, but instinc senses this is someone you don't mess with.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll wait outside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie Rose watches him leave with a look of contempt, th turns back to Driver with a smile, resuming their convers  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reason I'm telling you this is because he's got a lot invested in you. So do I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes stay on each other with just a hint of tension  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything you need just let me know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver nods. Bernie Rose studies him a moment, then final walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver joins Standard in the forecourt of the garage, the sun blazing down on them.   (CONTINUED) 36 9/24/10 67 CONTINUED: 67  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene told me you'd fixed our car. How much do I owe you?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do worry. I like to pay my debts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver senses the quiet pride in his voice, and lets it g  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call it fifty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard counts out some bills from his tattered wallet, eyes lowered.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking of trading her in for a new car. Something fast and cheap.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't have both.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright then, fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even though he smiles Driver senses just a hint of tensio his handsome face.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pointing to a car) Something like that Buick over there'll cost you nine grand but there isn't much point in a city where you can't drive faster than sixty five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard considers the car a moment, something clearly bo him, then looks back at Driver.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must think I'm an asshole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver isn't sure what he's getting at.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't know.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I am. Six months inside for holding somebody else's stolen shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles ironically, his gaze still fixed on Driver.  (CONTINUED) 37 9/24/10 67 CONTINUED: (2) 67  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate what you did for my family when I was away but I don't plan to fuck up a second time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a thinly veiled message that he's back and here to s Driver stares back at him when Shannon emerges from the g with Bernie Rose and Nino, calling out.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, kid! Come say goodbye, the money people are leaving!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver and Standard stare at each other a moment longer t Driver breaks off.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver walks off, leaving Standard alone with his thought Shannon watches Standard curiously as Driver approaches.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene's husband.  SHANNON (GRINNING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I tell you about married women?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nino can't resist another dig at Shannon.  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck do you know about married women?  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you for once say something without the word fuck in it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they continue their banter, Driver glances at Standard walking back to his car, dialling someone on his cell pho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passing traffic blurs past. Through the windows of a Mexi restaurant we see Irene at work, serving tables in her waitress's uniform.   (CONTINUED) 38 9/24/10 68 CONTINUED: 68

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver's parked across the street, watching her from his hesitates, conflicted, then finally gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene walks out of the kitchen with a tray of food, then as she sees Driver sitting at a booth. She looks surprise see him, but pleased, serving her table first then headin  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi...  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes stay on each other, oblivious to the noise.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't seen you around in a while. You must have been pretty busy?...  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look pretty busy yourself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles, glancing at the tables she's supposed to serv  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I get you?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already ate. I just wanted to see how you were?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His concern touches her and makes her uncomfortable at th time.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're okay. Standard thinks he may have found a job so I can give up my night shift...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver stares back at her with his intense gaze.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benicio misses you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the way she says it she could almost be talking abou herself.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps asking me to invite you for dinner...    (CONTINUED) 39 9/24/10 69 CONTINUED: 69  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His gentle gaze is finally too much for her. She grins, e herself.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better serve some food...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only when she has her back turned that we see how ha is for her. Driver watches her walk away, lost in thought

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene piles some plates of tacos on her tray, bracing her go back out and face Driver -- but when she finally walks again he's no longer there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver leans out of his car window and inserts a key to o gates of the underground car park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Driver descends into the darkness of the car park, he group of SHADOWY FIGURES walking in the opposite directio heading up the ramp, one of them being pushed in a wheelc Their leader, a large, balding man, (COOK), glances in Dr direction then looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver cruises past the mysterious group and winds his wa further down the car park. Suddenly he notices something the shadows. A figure lies sprawled against one of the pi A smaller figure kneels a few feet away. Driver stops his now, climbing out to see what's happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prone figure groans in pain. As Driver approaches he realizes it's Standard. His face is covered in blood and clutches his ribs. The smaller figure is Benicio. He star his father helplessly, then looks up at Driver in tears. kneels beside Standard, checking nothing's broken.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you move?  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Benicio?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver glances at Benicio. He looks terrified. Standard r his head painfully and looks at his son.  (CONTINUED) 40 9/24/10 72 CONTINUED: 72  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Benicio. I'm okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver watches the boy struggling to hold back his tears.  STANDARD (GENTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say anything to your mother, you understand? This is between you and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benicio nods, too choked-up to speak. Standard turns to D  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I use your bathroom to clean up? I don't want Irene to come home and see me like this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard is bent over the sink, splashing water on his fa he turns off the tap he notices how neatly Driver's laid toothbrush, shaving cream, and razor. He finally turns ar and looks at Driver.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Sorry about getting all this blood everywhere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still shaken but tries to pass it off with a smile.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking punks took me by surprise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver watches him, unconvinced.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking punks didn't look like they needed to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard looks at him in surprise now.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw them, huh?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver doesn't answer, waiting for him to continue. Stand hesitates, still not sure whether to trust him.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever been inside?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?    (CONTINUED) 41 9/24/10 73 CONTINUED: 73

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard takes another glance at the items laid out neatl the sink.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I owed some protection money in the joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver begins to see how worried he is.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want twenty thousand. I told them I couldn't pay so they want me to do a job for them...  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that why you need a car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard stares back at him.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say you were inside for?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, then he finally opens up.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a pawn shop in the valley. I tried to back out tonight, they said they'd come after Irene and Benicio next time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver stares at him in surprise now, more concerned than shows.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you take them away?  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where would I go? Irene finds out I fucked up again I'll lose everything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sounds upset, angry with himself.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This lousy job's my only way out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver stares at his battered face and the blood stains o shirt, then walks out of the bathroom to check on Benicio 42 9/24/10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benicio is watching a baseball game on TV, his back to Dr  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little boy nods without turning round, still frighten his ordeal.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want something to drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benicio shakes his head, trying to hide his tears. Driver over, then stops as he notices something in Benicio's han little boy is clutching it as if he's afraid to let go.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you got there?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benicio holds out his hand to reveal a small bullet. Driv stares at it, then looks at him.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who gave you that?...  BENICIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of those men. He told me not to lose it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
