dialogues.text: Driver gazes at the little boy's frightened face in conce his eyes faraway, thinking to himself.  75 OMITTED 75

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An outdoor food shack in a park. COOK, the leader of the of men who beat Standard up in the parking lot, sits at a with his girlfriend, BLANCHE, a stunning blonde with shor cropped hair.  COOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got you to do this fucking job for me, why do I need to pay someone else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard sits next to Driver, holding his ground even tho he's clearly intimidated by the Albanian.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll pay him out of what's left of my share. I can't do something like this on my own.   (CONTINUED) 43 9/24/10 76 CONTINUED: 76  COOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got Blanche...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grins, looking at Driver now. Blanche doesn't even see hear them, hung-over from the previous night.  COOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like you're hard to work with?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if we understand each other.  COOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's to understand? It's my score. Either you sign on or you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver stares at him quietly, finding it hard to conceal contempt.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I drive. That's all I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blanche gets up from the table before Cook can respond.  COOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?  BLANCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've forgotten my Coke.  COOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll bring it. Sit down. (His eyes still fixed on Driver) Standard, why don't you hire a fucking taxi cab?  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't mean it like that, man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard looks worried, trying to diffuse the tension.  COOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what does he mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver looks him calmly in the eye.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell me where we start, where we're headed, where we'll be going afterwards. I don't take part, I don't carry weapons, I drive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard seems surprised by Driver's professional patter. does Cook. Even Blanche looks interested for once.  (CONTINUED) 44 9/24/10 76 CONTINUED: (2) 76  COOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard, get Blanche her coca cola.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard hesitates, but has no choice. As he leaves to fe Blanche her drink, Cook starts to write something down on palm of his hand.  COOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, here's the deal. This much for Blanche, this much for that asshole minus what he owes me, and this much for you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up the palm of his hand to Driver, the words Fuc written in marker pen.  COOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still interested?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver looks at him, all his instincts telling him to wal but he stays where he is, thinking of Irene and Benicio.  COOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Anything else?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver stares back at him with his clear blue eyes.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do this job he's paid his debt. You leave him and his family alone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cook looks surprised at first, then laughs at his nerve.  COOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you say, boss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The midday sun beats down on a maze of cars. Driver strol rows of glittering vehicles until he spots an old model M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver sits at the dinner table with Standard, Irene and now. Standard's in high spirits, beaming at his wife.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I was such a jerk the first time we met. We're at this party and I see the most beautiful girl I ever laid eyes on and I walk over and say, `Hello Miss, my name's Standard Guzman'. She takes one look at me and asks, `Where's the deluxe version?'... (HE LAUGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It took me like a minute to get it...  (CONTINUED) 45 9/24/10 78 CONTINUED: 78

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene smiles awkwardly, glancing at Driver. Benicio grins to please his dad.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't get it either do you, Benicio? Hope you didn't inherit your Papa's brains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ruffles his son's hair then pours himself another shot tequila. Irene notices he's drinking, turning to Driver.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like some more chicken?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes stay on each as she serves him. Standard sees look between them but his only reaction is to drain his g and tuck into his food.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now this is what I call a deluxe chicken. Irene and I are gonna open a restaurant together once I raise the money. That's why she's working in that Mexican joint. Figure out how it's done. She's got more ambition than anyone I know, more smarts too... (He raises his glass) We're gonna drive all those fucking Mexicans out of business -  IRENE STANDARD -  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse my language, Benicio...  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Changing the subject) How's the movie going?...  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene looks at Standard as he pours himself another drink  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think that's enough?  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, we're celebrating. I've got my family around me and our new friend...    (CONTINUED) 46 9/24/10 78 CONTINUED: (2) 78

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises his glass to Driver now. Driver senses how nerv is about the job ahead, and how uncomfortable he is depen someone his wife clearly admires.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you working on anything else?  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop asking the poor guy all these QUESTIONS -  IRENE (LOSING PATIENCE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why don't you go ahead and talk for all of us.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, I will. This time next week I'm gonna take you and Benicio away with me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene stops and looks at him in surprise.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you wanna go, Benicio?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His quiet confidence concerns her even more.  BENICIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disneyland.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget Disneyland. I'm gonna take you and your mother away from this bullshit city -  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benicio, it's time for bed -  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your papa's got it all figured out -  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benicio, you heard me -  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. I'll take him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard gets up from the table, lifting Benicio up in hi and carrying him back to his bedroom. Driver watches them in this kind of mood Standard's clearly devoted to his so Irene waits until they're gone, then turns back to Driver  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.   (CONTINUED) 47 9/24/10 78 CONTINUED: (3) 78  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hesitates, torn, then looks up at him again, needing confide in someone.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every time he makes that speech about taking me and Benicio away from here he's in some kind of trouble...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver sees the deep concern in her eyes and feels even m torn. Irene gets up, clearing away some plates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver strides through the parking lot and climbs in his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver sits in the car as if it's his retreat from the wo stares out, then turns on a stop watch, listening to it t finding his balance again in the familiarity of the ritua

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pawn shop is nothing much to look at from the outside another anonymous LA store front. Driver's parked the car hundred yards from the entrance, his police scanner crack Standard sits beside him in the passenger seat, looking t  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to do this.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Forcing a smile) What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to make light of it but doesn't sound convincing of his window he sees Blanche cross the street and enter pawn shop and looks even more nervous now.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene and Benicio think the world of you, you know that, right?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver glances at him, sensing his anxiety.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say something happens to me, you think you could find a way to take care of them?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard's still staring ahead, but Driver can sense his   (CONTINUED) 48 9/24/10 81 CONTINUED: 81  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not too late...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard considers a moment, then shakes his head.  STANDARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta do this for them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He forces a smile, slips on his sunglasses, then finally the door.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got five minutes...  STANDARD (GRINNING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you in four...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver watches him cross the street with a strong sense o foreboding. Standard enters the pawn shop. Driver starts stopwatch now, listening to the seconds tick away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He casts his eyes around the street, observing the smalle details -- the number plates of other vehicles; the windo overlooking buildings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The white hot sun blazes down, reflecting on the pawn sho windows, hiding everything inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police scanner crackles but picks up no activity. Dri listens to his stop watch, in his own world. He starts th engine and sets off, cruising slowly past the pawn shop, for the corner where he told Standard he'd be waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls over by the curb when suddenly he notices someth Parked a hundred yards down the road he sees another vehi glinting in the sunlight. To the ordinary eye it's no dif from the other cars parked nearby, but to Driver it stand For one, it's a Chrysler. Secondly, it has reinforced bum and racing tires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver's stopwatch shows four minutes now. He looks away the Chrysler, gazing at the doors of the pawn shop, expec Standard and Blanche to burst out at any moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's no sign of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The seconds tick away. Five minutes. Driver hesitates, al instincts telling him to drive off, but he stays where he thinking of Irene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly he sees Standard and Blanche emerge from the paw Standard clutching a big black gym bag in his hand.   (CONTINUED) 49 9/24/10 81 CONTINUED: (2) 81

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles at Driver as he approaches when suddenly he hea crack of gunshots behind him. Driver sees the look of pan his face as he spins around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUY IN A SUIT strides out of the pawn shop. Crouching l an expert firing position he squeezes off several shots. force of the bullets sends Standard flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver sees him hit the sidewalk, arterial blood pumping his neck. Blanche screams, grabbing the gym bag and leapi the back seat of the car. Driver hesitates, takes one las at Standard's lifeless body, then hits the gas as more gu crack behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Driver's car roars down the street, the Chrysler sudde comes to life, pulling out of its parking place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver glances in his rear-view mirror and sees the Chrys his tail. It doesn't seem to be trying to close the gap, following at a discreet distance. In the back seat, Blanc open the gym bag, then stares in shock.  BLANCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Christ, there wasn't supposed to be this much money!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are literally stacks of hundred dollar bills cramme inside the gym bag. Driver catches her reaction in the mi but his attention is focussed on the Chrysler. Up ahead, intersection, the lights turn red. Driver thinks about ru them, but decides against it, braking sharply. The Chrysl draws up beside him, its windows glinting in the sunlight  BLANCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move for Chrissakes!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver ignores her, still watching the Chrysler out of th corner of his eye. The lights change to green but Driver move. Nor does the Chrysler. Behind them, other cars star honking their horns. Suddenly Driver roars off, swerving speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chrysler reacts, screeching off in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver floors the gas. On speed and power his vehicle may match for the Chrysler, but in traffic the odds are even. weaves his way past the slower cars, putting obstacles be himself and the Chrysler. The pursuing car matches him mo move, staying on his tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the back seat, Blanche looks terrified, buckling herse   (CONTINUED) 49A 9/24/10 82 CONTINUED: 82

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver swerves left then suddenly makes a hard right onto deserted canyon road. The mustang somehow manages to make the same turn. It gets close enough to "pit" Driver, its pressing against the rear corner of Driver's vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver's almost run off the road, but manages to save it regains control of his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mustang pulls out wide to build momentum and smash in him. As it moves in to deliver the knockout blow, Driver pulls the Emergency Brake and spins 180 degrees, causing Mustang to miss and lose control for a brief moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the two cars are nose to nose, barrelling down the ro Driver heading in reverse as fast as he can, the Mustang closing fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It rams Driver's front bumper. BAM! The two cars separate for an instant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mustang guns it, ready to smash into Driver again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver clocks an upcoming three way intersection dotted w construction equipment. In a last ditch attempt to evade pursuer he throws a reverse 180, then incredibly keeps go spinning 270 degrees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mustang tries to make the same turn, but this time th maneuver is beyond his ability. Driver's suckered him int corner he can't control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mustang crashes into the construction equipment in a sickening crunch of metal on metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver guns the motor and speeds away.  50 9/24/10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Purple neon spills onto the forecourt of a seedy motel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black gym bag lies open on a double bed, full to the with stacks of cash. Blanche sits on the bed, looking pal  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much did Cook tell you you could expect to net?  BLANCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty Grand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances at the bag, staring at how much more money th Driver switches on the cheap TV set with the remote, flic through the news channels. There's no mention of the robb yet. He zips up the bag and heads out.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here. Don't answer the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blanche nods, too shaken to protest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver hesitates, then dials a number on his cell-phone. answers.

dialogues.speaker: BENICIO'S VOICE ON THE PHONE
dialogues.text: Hello?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver hears the tremor in his voice.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benicio?...

dialogues.speaker: BENICIO'S VOICE ON THE PHONE
dialogues.text: Yeah?...  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your mom there?...     (CONTINUED) 51 9/24/10 85 CONTINUED: 85

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an uncomfortable silence. Driver can feel the lit trying to hold it together.

dialogues.speaker: BENICIO'S VOICE ON THE PHONE
dialogues.text: She's talking to the police...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 85a INT. IRENE'S APARTMENT/ ECHO PARK - DAY. 85a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the living room we can see Irene sitting on the couch male and female POLICE OFFICER, looking dazed, taking in news of Standard's death.  INTERCUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver pauses, still on the phone to Benicio.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her I'll call later...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A soap opera plays on the TV. Driver walks back into the room. Blanche lies on the bed, looking more relaxed. Driv picks up the remote and flicks through the channels until finally finds a breaking news story on the robbery. There police mug-shot of Standard on screen.  TV REPORT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The armed robber was pronounced dead at the scene. He was identified as Standard Guzman of Echo Park, Los Angeles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver listens to the report in silence. Blanche seems up again, confronted with the reality of what's happened.  TV REPORT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Other details are unclear but the owner of the pawn shop told reporters that the robber had no accomplices and that the items he'd taken had been recovered. In other news...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver switches off the TV, staring at the blank screen i surprise. He turns to Blanche.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy saw you grab the money and jump in the car -- why didn't he say anything?  BLANCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've no idea.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any idea there'd be another car waiting?  (CONTINUED) 52 9/24/10 86 CONTINUED: 86

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time she takes a fraction too long to answer.  BLANCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already told you everything -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver suddenly slaps her -- hard.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just got a little kid's father killed. You think I won't hurt you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises his hand to slap her again and this time she ta tears welling in her eyes.  BLANCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Cook told me another car would hold us up...but he never said anything about this much money or anyone getting killed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver stares at her quietly, beginning to put the pieces together in his head.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were gonna rip us off and split the take?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods guiltily.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you known him?  BLANCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a couple months. We were fooling around. I've never been mixed up in anything like this -  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know his real name?  BLANCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He told me it was Chris, but I just called him Cook.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to take me to him right now, you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods, terrified, tears running down her face.  BLANCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ....Can I go wash up?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver nods distractedly, his mind racing. Blanche heads the bathroom.  (CONTINUED) 53 9/24/10 86 CONTINUED: (2) 86

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she disappears inside Driver notices something on the where she's just been lying. It's her cell phone. Still f open as if she's called someone recently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver reaches for the cell phone when he notices the sil of a MAN crossing the curtains. Someone's outside. The do handle of the motel room starts to turn, slowly -- then s there's the roar of a shotgun from the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver reacts in an instant, rushing towards the bathroom He has to barge it open, something obstructing his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver almost trips over Blanche's sprawled body as he bu through. One quick glance and he knows she's dead - half head blown off. Another quick glance and he sees her kill big burly HITMAN, trying to climb through the same bathro window where he just shot her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver moves like lightning, grabbing the man's arms befo can get off another shot and pulling him through the wind hitman lands heavily in a sea of broken glass, cutting hi forehead open, blinded momentarily by the blood in his ey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver takes his opportunity and slams the man's face bac the glass strewn floor, stunning him for a few more secon they struggle. Crawling away, he grabs the towel rack and the metal bar off the wall. Using it as a spear he impale hitman and grabs his shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the bedroom, the 2nd HITMAN finally kicks the door ope Driver bursts through the bathroom door at the same time firing the 1st shooter's shotgun. The force of the blast up the 2nd hitman and flings him against the wall like a doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The startling explosion of violence is over just as sudde it began. Driver slumps to the floor in exhaustion, his h his arm ripped open by the broken glass. There's blood sp all over the wall. Neon lights from outside flashing on t man's face. But no panicked footsteps or sirens yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver crawls over to the dead hitman and rifles through pockets. All he finds are a set of car keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon stands in his office, listening silently on the p looking like he's been punched in the gut.    (CONTINUED) 54 9/24/10 89 CONTINUED: 89  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All he hears is silence on the other end.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess it's done now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans back against a car.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How big's the take?...

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER'S VOICE ON THE PHONE
dialogues.text: One million I guess...  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks dazed by the thought of so much money.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better bring it over.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER'S VOICE ON THE PHONE
dialogues.text: I'm hurt. I need a doctor to patch me up...  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take care of it...  90 OMITTED 90

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An underworld doctor, "DOC", a shabbily dressed old man w looks well past his prime takes out a small bottle of sco along with his surgical tools, preparing for Driver's arr Shannon watches him uncertainly then heads downstairs as hears a noise in the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon arrives downstairs to see Driver walking unsteadi towards him in the gloom. Shannon can't help glancing at hands, expecting him to be carrying the bag with the mone there's no sign of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scissoring Driver's blood soaked shirt away Doc examines shards of glass embedded in his arm, then notices the dee running down his back.    (CONTINUED) 55 9/24/10 93 CONTINUED: 93  DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Looks like you got more metal inside you than a ten ton truck... (His hand shakes) You'd be better off with a mechanic not a medic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver looks up at him warily from Shannon's pull out bed  DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax. Just having my fun with you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc picks up his bottle of scotch from among his bowls of Peroxide and Betadine, takes a drink, then offers it to D  DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a hit off that. Chances are you'll need it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver shakes his head, closing his eyes. Shannon watches quietly, concerned for him but also curious about the mon  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do with the cash?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon hesitates, but can't help himself.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to look after it for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver doesn't answer, gritting his teeth as Doc pulls ou largest shard of glass.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just think what we could do with all that DOUGH -  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two guys just tried to kill me for it. I want to find out who it belongs to first...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon nods, coming back down to earth.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy Cook got a real name?...  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe Chris. Probably not...  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll ask Bernie if he's heard of him...  (CONTINUED) 56 9/24/10 93 CONTINUED: (2) 93

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver grimaces again as Doc pulls out another shard of g  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you'd talked to me first...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver doesn't reply, his eyes fixed on the ceiling.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lotta guys fall for other mens' wives, but you're the only one I know robs a joint to make it up to the husband...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An elegant apartment full of framed photographs of beauti grandchildren and movie posters from Hollywood's golden a Bernie is in his silk pyjamas, looking like he's just wok  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want some coffee?  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thanks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon looks tense but tries to hide it. From next door can hear the sound of raised voices. Bernie Rose grabs th remote and turns up the volume to drown out his neighbors  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've been going at it ever since they moved in. She's such a nice lady but it's a lousy Shidach. It's a wonder they haven't killed each other... (A BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what's your interest in the Seventh Heaven?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon doesn't understand, looking confused.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a strip joint on La Cienega. Your friend Cook runs it. Why're you curious about him all of a sudden?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even though they're close, Shannon's wary of giving away much information.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A friend of mine owes him some money. I was wondering if you knew him?  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know him. He's a crazy Albanian. If I were your friend I'd pay up.  (CONTINUED) 57 9/24/10 94 CONTINUED: 94

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie Rose pours himself a cup of coffee in the kitchene  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wake me up this early this friend must be a close friend?  SHANNON (HESITATING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's our car by the way?  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all set for next month.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And our driver?  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's doing great.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you should worry about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon smiles back but Bernie senses how distracted he i  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want my advice? Let your friend work it out for himself. Don't take pills for other people's headaches... (HE GRINS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got twenty minutes? I need you to run down to the market and get me some milk...  95 OMITTED 95

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunlight pours through a doorway. Driver heads down some passing some half naked STRIPPERS at the bar. There's a h of CLIENTS watching a pole dance, but otherwise the place empty. Driver turns down a long corridor. A couple of STR emerge from their changing room, surprised to see him, bu puts them at ease with a friendly smile.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cook moved office again?  STRIPPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That one over there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver smiles gratefully, then heads towards an office at end of the corridor. He knocks on the door. A voice calls  (CONTINUED) 58 9/24/10 96 CONTINUED: 96

dialogues.speaker: COOK O/S
dialogues.text: It's open...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver takes a hammer out of his jacket, then starts turn door handle as if he can't get in.

dialogues.speaker: COOK O/S
dialogues.text: It's open, goddamit!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hears Cook striding impatiently towards the door now. waits, then suddenly kicks the door open, right in Cook's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Cook can recover, Driver storms into the office, s him across the shoulder with the hammer. Cook collapses i heap. Driver's about to hit him again, when he sees that left hand is broken and there are cuts and bruises on his Someone's clearly given him a beating since the robbery.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should've figured you for a shill. Who were you fronting for?  COOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver smashes the hammer into Cook's right hand now, bre it too. Cook screams. Some of the strippers have gathered door but Driver couldn't care less.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose money am I holding?  COOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. They'll come get it. You don't know who you're fucking with -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver smashes the hammer into the metal plates supportin Cook's left hand. He screams like a stuck pig.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's money am I holding?  COOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Barely able to get the words out) Fuck you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The strippers look stunned and riveted at the same time. bends over Cook and rifles through his pockets. Finally h what he's looking for. Cook's cell phone. He scrolls down call log and finds the same number appearing again and ag  97 OMITTED 97 59 9/24/10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kitchen is busy, CHEFS taking out hot pizzas from the and slicing them up in takeaway boxes. In the background the phone ringing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An impeccably dressed MAN IN A TAN SUIT answers the phone  TAN SUIT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?...I'm afraid we're closed. Could you call back after twelve...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (INTERCUT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver leans against his car, talking on Cook's cell phon  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could, but your boss won't be happy when he finds out you've kept him waiting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tan Suit looks curious now.  TAN SUIT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask what this is about?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have something that belongs to him.  TAN SUIT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that would be?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A million dollars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a pause on the other line now.

dialogues.speaker: TAN SUIT O/S
dialogues.text: Please hold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tan Suit walks into the dining area. A large bull of a ma on his own in the empty restaurant with his back to us. I only when he hears Tan Suit approach and turns around tha realize it's Nino, Bernie's partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver hears a heavy chesty voice come on the line.   (CONTINUED) 60 9/24/10 102 CONTINUED: 102

dialogues.speaker: NINO O/S
dialogues.text: You have something that fucking belongs to me?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The voice is unmistakable. Driver stares quietly.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems that way...  (INTERCUT)  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're calling me why? You expect me to buy my fucking stuff back from you?...  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not selling. I give you a time and place, you come collect your stuff...  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what do you get out of it?...  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just that. Out of it. You put a muzzle on Cook, forget your zombies at the Motel, forget we ever had this conversation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nino's thinking to himself, looking more concerned than h sounds.  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your partners happy with that?...  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have partners...  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You discuss this with anyone else?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nino begins to relax now, still calculating.  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not very good at this, are you?...  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't what I do. I'll call again with instructions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver switches the cell phone off. 61 9/24/10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nino hangs up. Behind him we see that Tan Suit is also in room, waiting for his orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene is sitting on the couch next to Benicio, talking to gently as he watches TV.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'll be back before you go to bed. How's that sound?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little boy nods, watching his Japanese cartoon. Irene friend, Cindy, is also there, gazing at them both in symp Irene looks up at her.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to be okay?  CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be fine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene gets up to leave when the buzzer rings. She walks o opens the door then stops in surprise. Driver stands ther  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a minute?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him in a daze.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have you been?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares back at her in silence.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to reach you. Standard's been -  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes stay on her, as if he's trying to tell her somet more. She looks confused, staring back at him curiously w small voice interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: BENICIO O/S
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver looks over at the little boy.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...  (CONTINUED) 62 9/24/10 104 CONTINUED: 104

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene begins to see the guilt in his eyes and slowly it h her. She stares in disbelief, reeling.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about your father...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benicio nods. Driver keeps staring at the boy but can't f more words of comfort. Irene watches him, still stunned. looks back at her.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't talk now. I have to go.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I give you a ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at him in dismay, close to tears.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car's working fine.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let me walk you down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants to say no but can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver and Irene head down the long corridor in silence.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Almost a whisper) Why?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver misunderstands, thinking she's talking about Stand  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was into one of the prison gangs for a lot of money. He was trying to protect you.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great job...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks faster now, striding towards the elevator. Driv follows her.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still have the money. Whatever you need -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns around and slaps him hard.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, a bank? I work for a living. I don't need your widow's pension!  (CONTINUED) 63 9/24/10 105 CONTINUED: 105

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes well up with tears, staring at him in anger and frustration.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me one thing. How did he talk you into it?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't talk me into anything. I've been doing this my whole life. It's what I do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at him in deep disappointment.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns away when the elevator bell rings. The doors op revealing TAN SUIT. Neither Driver or Irene recognizes hi we do. He smiles, pretending to look confused.  TAN SUIT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I'm supposed to be going down...  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps into the elevator. Driver follows her in.  TAN SUIT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which floor?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parking lot, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tan Suit presses the button and the doors slide shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver and Irene ride down in silence, their eyes fixed o other. Tan Suit watches them quietly, considering a move, Driver glances at him and he smiles, biding his time. The on the panel descend. The elevator bell finally rings as reach the lower level. Tan Suit hesitates, but Driver wai him to go out first. He nods goodnight and heads off into darkness of the parking lot. Driver follows Irene, the tw them heading in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The overhead lights flicker, the huge underground car par hidden in shadow. Driver walks alongside Irene in silence the distance Tan Suit's footsteps slowly fade.    (CONTINUED) 64 9/24/10 107 CONTINUED: 107  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm leaving. I want you to come with me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene can't believe what she's hearing.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Benicio...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's almost too stunned to speak, walking even faster no  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy. I don't even know you -  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will. Once I straighten out this thing I'm getting out for good. We'll go some place. Anywhere you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head, fighting her feelings for him.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't work like that.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops and looks at him.  IRENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because people like you never get out. And I don't want my son to grow up like that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds his gaze with regret. Driver's about to respond suddenly he catches a fleeting movement out of the corner eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat -- then he suddenly lunges -- grabbing Irene and p her to the ground. In the same instant Tan Suit appears o the darkness, opening fire with his automatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullets spark as they hit the concrete floor and the othe parked vehicles. Driver drags Irene behind a car now, cov her with his body as Tan Suit fires another burst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More sparks light up the darkness, the bullets penetratin car with ease, narrowly missing Driver and Irene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver moves again, dragging the terrified Irene behind h Suit loses sight of them in the darkness, striding past r parked cars.   (CONTINUED) 65 9/24/10 107 CONTINUED: (2) 107

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver turns to Irene as they take cover behind a pillar. looks terrified -- not just of Tan Suit but of him. It's all her worst fears have been confirmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver stares back at her, then hears Tan Suit's footstep approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds her gaze apologetically, then gets to his feet a runs, trying to draw Tan Suit's fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tan Suit hears him and opens up again, more bullets light the darkness. Driver keeps moving. Tan Suit strides after reloading, when suddenly his gun jams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crouching behind another vehicle, Driver sees this and ta chance, darting out after his pursuer. Tan Suit sees him and runs, the hunter becoming the hunted now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still lying on the ground, Irene listens to their echoing footsteps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver runs after Tan Suit through the darkness, gaining time. Tan Suit looks desperate now, tiring. He turns to f pursuer but Driver's on him in a flash, hurling him again car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tan Suit slams into the car, losing his balance. Driver g him, swinging him around, smashing him into another car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene's watching from the shadows, stunned by the violenc picks herself up and runs towards the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver keeps slamming Tan Suit against the car, beating t resistance out of him. As his body begins to slump, Drive him by the throat and rams his head into a car window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The glass splinters with blood, the force of the blow sha Tan Suit's skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver looks around for Irene now and sees her standing i elevator, framed against the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares back at him, but makes no attempt to step out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver stands there, his hands covered in Tan Suit's bloo elevator doors finally close, hiding Irene from view.  108 OMITTED 108

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 108a EXT. LA STREET - NIGHT. 108a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon gets out of his car. Driver is waiting for him by own car, silhouetted against the streetlight. Shannon sta him a moment, then notices the blood stains on his shirt.  (CONTINUED) 66 9/24/10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 108a CONTINUED: 108a  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nino's guys came after me. How did they know about Irene?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon takes a moment to reply, looking dazed.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called Bernie...I asked if he could help. Him and Nino are like brothers. I told him you weren't interested in the money, that you only did it for the girl... (From the heart) I wanted to make sure once you returned the money that was the end of it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver doesn't seem to hear him.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me talk to Bernie again. They probably didn't listen to him -  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon says nothing now, knowing he's right.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gonna come after you to find me. You have to leave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon takes this in slowly.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver doesn't answer, but from his silence Shannon can g  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the fuck did this happen? We're supposed be in Charlotte or Daytona drinking champagne out of trophies and getting laid by pit lizards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at Driver with quiet regret.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie Rose looks quietly furious.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I already gave you my advice. You should have taken your money and left this guy alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nino and Cook sit opposite him, both of Cook's hands brok  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that simple, Bernie.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now that it's bounced up in your face.  COOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Paolozzi, I owe you this guy. Just give me the okay and I'll -  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like taking orders, go shut the blinds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Cook's broken hands.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun's in my eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nino doesn't look at Cook, a clear indication he should d he's told. Cook stands up, humiliated, and walks over to windows. Bernie Rose waits for Nino to explain.  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The money belonged to a half assed wiseguy from Philly. I had a tip-off he was keeping a million in a pawn shop and was gonna invest it here in LA, try to run a rival operation. I wanted to teach him a lesson...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights in the restaurant gradually fade as Cook shuts blinds.  BERNIE ROSE (INCREDULOUSLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stole from the East Coast mob?  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stole from a jumped up punk who was gonna step on our business -     (CONTINUED) 68 9/24/10 110 CONTINUED: 110  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where did this punk find a million dollars? You ever consider he may have consulted some higher-ups? You even bother to check? -  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a fuck who gave him their blessing. This is my city -  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your city? This is a big city, pal, and last time I checked we were partners! -  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are partners -  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why the fuck didn't you come to me before you set up your dummy robbery or hired this fucking amateur?!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cook sits back down at the table, having closed the blind looks almost embarrassed for once.  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was off to the side, Bernie. I didn't wanna involve you.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, now you fucked up I am involved. Anyone finds out you stole from the family they'll kill both of us -  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What family? These fucks still call me a kike to my face. I'm fifty nine years old, they pinch my cheek, treat me like a fuckin' kid. They're the reason we left New York in the first place. Decrepit old men waving us over to their dinner and domino tables to complain.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those old men gave us the funds to move out here.  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I made them a lotta money. I made you a lotta money too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at Bernie, genuinely indignant now.    (CONTINUED) 69 9/24/10 110 CONTINUED: (2) 110  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I pay them half of everything I fucking earn and then they set up some fucking kid from Philadelphia just because he's a fucking wop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a hint of sympathy in Bernie's eyes.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The money always flows up, Izzy. You know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He calls Nino by his childhood name now, emphasizing the that they're both outsiders in this organization. For the time Nino's tough guy act slips and he looks anxious.  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why this driver has to go. Him, and maybe your friend Shannon, are the only two people who can tie me to the robbery.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about this prick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't even bother to look at Cook.  COOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Paolozzi -  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two friends stare at each other as if Cook didn't exi  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you asking my permission?  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm asking for your help. I shoulda' come to you first, Bernie. I know that. We're a team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at Bernie apologetically, appealing to their friendship.  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll pay you back the three hundred you spent on the race car.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not about the money...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares out quietly, torn.   (CONTINUED) 70 9/24/10 110 CONTINUED: (3) 110  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nino nods in gratitude.  BERNIE ROSE (TO COOK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pass the salt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cook hesitates, thinking Bernie's fucking with him for ha two broken hands. He stares back dumbly and it's the fina straw. Bernie suddenly grabs a stainless steel fork and r in his eye. As Cook screams, Bernie takes a knife and bur in his neck. He twists the knife deeper for good measure, with one powerful sweep of his arm clears Cook off the ta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cook's not dead yet, just writhing on the floor, choking own blood. Bernie Rose keeps his eyes fixed on Nino.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your turn to clean up after me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 110a EXT. TRAILER/ FILM SET/ SAN PEDRO/ LOS ANGELES - MOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CREW are setting up for their first shot of the day. background we see a DIRECTOR blocking out an action scene Driver walks past without even a glance, heading towards make-up trailer. He opens the door and walks in, looking the trailer until he finds what he's looking for -- the S he saw previously on the film set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon limps down the steps from his office with a suitc his hand. He heads into the main garage then suddenly sto Bernie Rose stands beside the stock car, waiting for him.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All these priceless cars, you should get better locks...  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Door's always open to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie Rose heads towards him with his hands in his coat pockets.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going somewhere?  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thinking about it.    (CONTINUED) 71 9/24/10 111 CONTINUED: 111  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for your driver.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You break in like this I figure it's bad news.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bad luck. Two thousand heists in this city a year, he had to pick the wrong one.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tried to put it right.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picked the wrong guy for that too. My partner's a belligerent asshole with his back against the wall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops, facing Shannon.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now so am I. I don't take care of this I'm in big trouble...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at his old friend.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any idea where he is?  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably across the border by now. Mexico. Belize. That's where I'd go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie Rose smiles, not believing a word.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just walked out on you after everything you've done for him, took all the money?  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's gratitude, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie Rose can't help grinning, fond of Shannon despite everything.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ever tell you how long Izzy and I been friends? Since we were six. Only Jews in a neighborhood of wops. Long as I can remember he was getting me into trouble and I was getting him out of scrapes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks almost apologetic.  (CONTINUED) 72 9/24/10 111 CONTINUED: (2) 111  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone else I'd take your side...  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone else I'd do the same...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie Rose watches him with a mixture of affection and r  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this fucking kid to you anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon shrugs, no idea himself.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I leave here without finding out where he is, there'll be others coming after me. I guarantee they'll be too stupid to figure out you won't talk and drag this out unnecessarily...  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'm glad you got here first...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie Rose holds his gaze, then looks away, admiring the stock car.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, it's too bad, I was getting excited about our race team, having my name all over the car. I think we could have made something of this business...  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I'd have fucked it up too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon smiles, reconciled with himself. Bernie Rose grin extends his hand. They shake hands firmly, like old frien when suddenly Shannon recoils, as if he's been stung.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see now that his shirt sleeve is covered in blood, his cut all the way from his elbow to his wrist. He looks daz paralysed with shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie Rose holds a razor knife in his hand, the blade we Shannon's blood. He takes Shannon gently by the arm and s down against the boot of the stock car.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't feel a thing. Close your eyes and you'll fall asleep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon stares out numbly, the life ebbing out of him. Be Rose watches him quietly, wiping his bloody razor with a handkerchief. 73 9/24/10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 111a INT. BERNIE ROSE'S APARTMENT - DAY. 111a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie Rose replaces the razor knife in a small lacquered full of other knives. From next door he can hear his neig arguing again. He stands there a moment, deflated, then s storms towards his front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 111b EXT. CORRIDOR/ BERNIE ROSE'S NEIGHBORS' APARTMENT -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loud knocking. Bernie Rose's neighbor opens his door.  HUSBAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie Rose, next apartment over -  HUSBAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know. I'm kind of busy here.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something threatening in the old mobster's eyes n husband moves to close the door but Bernie jams it open w elbow, shoves him aside, then looks over at the wife.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right, Shonda?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman nods without meeting his eyes.  HUSBAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the hell out of my -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie doesn't give him time to finish, clamping a powerf on his throat.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your fucking name?  HUSBAND LENNY -  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a patient man, Lenny, not much for getting in other people's way. What I figure is, we've all got our own lives, right? And the right to be left alone? (SQUEEZING HARDER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I sit next door for almost a year now listening to what goes down in here and I keep thinking, hey, they'll work it out. You gonna work it out, Lenny?  (CONTINUED) 74 9/24/10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 111b CONTINUED: 111b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jerks the husband's neck forward, making him nod.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lucky to have her, lucky she's put up with you this long. Lucky I've put up with you. She has good reason: she loves you. I don't have any reason at all. So stop raising your voice or fucking move...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lets go of the terrified man and storms out again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunlight glints on the parked vehicles by the curb. Drive down as he approaches the sign for Shannon's Custom Kings glancing out of the window to see if anyone's staking out garage. Satisfied there's no-one there, he drives through

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver pulls open the garage door and sees the rows of vi cars shimmering in the shafts of sunlight. As he heads pa vehicles he suddenly spots a figure slumped against the s car. Shannon's eyes have been closed, his head resting ge against the trunk of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver kneels down and lifts him up in his arms, holding a second, then lays him down on the floor. He turns back opens the car boot now, revealing the black gym bag full money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver's car roars out of the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nino stands in the kitchen, wearing a beautiful suit but shoes or socks, listening on his cell phone. We hold on t curious image for a moment, then reveal a beautifully dre WOMAN polishing his shoes. And now we see more of Nino's also smartly dressed and accompanied by GORGEOUS WOMEN, g ready for an event. Nino's talking to his wife on the pho  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright honey, I'll pick you up in an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two big Lincoln Towncars are parked outside. Across the r recognize Driver's car. He opens the trunk. When he close again we see that he's wearing the eerily convincing SFX He crosses the road, entering the pizzeria. 75 9/24/10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several of Nino's men look up as Driver enters but none o recognize him.  NINO'S GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're closed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver stares past them at Nino in the kitchen, surrounde more of his men. We feel his mind calculating then he wal again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nino emerges with his bodyguards now, heading towards one white Lincolns.  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To one of his men) I'm going to pick up my wife. I'll meet you there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the road Driver climbs into his car, still wearing mask. He starts his car, setting off after Nino's Lincoln

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver drifts in behind a couple of other cars, keeping t between himself and the Lincoln.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sunlight is fading fast. The neon cityscape has come and the streets are a sea of glittering lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CHAUFFEUR checks his mirror as he turns into another seeing only the anonymous glare of headlights behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver slows down and lets another car turn in front of h keeping it between himself and Nino's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The streets are less crowded in this residential area. As car in front of Driver pulls into its front drive, Driver the next turning, making sure the Lincoln doesn't spot hi 76 9/24/10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver cruises along another residential street. At every intersection we glimpse the Lincoln heading in the same direction down a parallel street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lincoln turns back into traffic on San Vincente.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nino's talking on a cell phone in the back seat.  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Sure, Carlo, I'll send him your regards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver merges in with the traffic, weaving between the ca front of him until he has Nino's Lincoln back in his sigh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun has almost set, the red backlights of the cars bl in the fading light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nino's car turns into 7th Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time there are no other vehicles turning into the sa street. Driver has no choice, settling in behind the Linc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chauffeur glances in his rear-view mirror and spots D car for the first time. For now he doesn't give it much t In the back seat Nino finally says goodbye on the phone.  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Nice talking to you too... (As he hangs up) Asshole...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both cars head into Entrada Drive. 77 9/24/10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chauffeur checks his mirror again and notices Driver' still on his tail. Just as a precaution he slows down, se the pursuing car will overtake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver has to decide in an instant whether to take up the invitation. He overtakes the Lincoln, speeding ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nino's chauffeur sees Driver's car disappear up ahead, re now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver puts his foot on the gas, taking sharp turns on sm side streets, driving fast around the block until he's ba the Lincoln's tail, keeping a safe distance now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nino's chauffeur turns right into the Pacific Coast Highw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver follows the Lincoln at a distance, keeping the win corners of the PCH between himself and his prey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From above we see Driver's car gliding along the open hig the rising hills on one side, the churning ocean on the o no vehicles in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the back seat Nino dials another number on his cell-ph  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Bernie, it's me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The headlights of Driver's car sweep ahead of it on the o road. From above it looks like a shark closing in on its

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie Rose stands by the window, listening to the phone silence. 78 9/24/10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nino sounds apologetic.  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Look, about that thing today...I'm sorry. I know how much you liked the guy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his rear view mirror the chauffeur sees the headlights car behind getting closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver stares ahead, his eyes fixed on the Lincoln's back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie Rose doesn't speak, looking weary.

dialogues.speaker: NINO O/S
dialogues.text: Bernie?...  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?...

dialogues.speaker: NINO O/S
dialogues.text: You're the only fucking person in the world I trust. I love you, man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie shakes his head, the same old apologies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the front seat Nino's chauffeur checks his mirror curi  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When this is over I'll make it up to you, I swear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights of the car behind have vanished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even from above we can't see Driver's car with its lights no idea how close it is to Nino's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even though he's still angry, Bernie can't help forgiving childhood friend.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many times I heard that before... 79 9/24/10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nino grins.  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lost count -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly blazing headlights explode to life behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver rams the Lincoln at over a hundred miles an hour, it just above the left rear wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The impact is momentous. The huge Continental is lifted u the air and spun round at the same time. It slams back in tarmac then flips end over end for a hundred yards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie Rose is left holding the phone as the line goes de

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The collision has barely knocked Driver off course. His c skids to a stop near the overturned wreck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Among the carnage, we see Nino, bloodied but still alive. unbuckles his seat belt and crawls out of the twisted wre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver gets out of his car, calmly walking over to the pulverized Lincoln. He sees Nino stumbling off towards th but doesn't hurry after him yet. He checks to make sure t other passengers are dead, then heads on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nino stumbles through the sand, running for his life now. looks behind him and sees Driver calmly pursuing him. He running, but he's badly injured, slowing all the time. Fe clouds reason and he staggers towards the crashing waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver slows down as he watches the gangster wade into th ocean, a pathetic last attempt to evade him. The crashing and the undertow are an impenetrable wall. Every time Nin to wade out further, the ocean drags him back.    (CONTINUED) 80 9/24/10 156 CONTINUED: 156

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver stares at his trapped prey. Nino's attempts become and more feeble as the ocean exhausts him and snuffs out hope of escape. Finally he retreats back into the shallow barely able to keep his footing. He turns around and face Driver, the crashing waves still smashing into his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stay like that for a moment. Gazing at each other. D silhouetted against the white sand. Nino trapped in the o Then Driver wades out into the water. Nino has no fight l him, staring at the masked man. Driver stares back at him grabs him by the throat, forcing his head under the water splutters as Driver lets him up again.  NINO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Bernie...Bernie Rose killed your friend not me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver shoves his face back under the water, keeping it t until Nino's body finally stops thrashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A phone shrills. Bernie Rose answers it.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nino?

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER'S VOICE ON THE PHONE
dialogues.text: He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie Rose stares out in silence. Whatever he thinks of part of him has died. We feel the regret in his eyes but no trace of emotion in his voice.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like me, you and your girlfriend are the only pieces left on the board...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver is no longer wearing a mask, framed against the oc catches the veiled threat in Bernie's words but doesn't r  INTERCUT  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say this has gone far enough. See any reason why it should go on?...  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't have to...     (CONTINUED) 81 9/24/10 158 CONTINUED: 158  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we should talk. You know a place called the Great Wall -- out on Sherman Way?

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER'S VOICE ON THE PHONE
dialogues.text: I can find it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie pauses, staring out.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE'S VOICE ON THE PHONE
dialogues.text: I'll see you there at one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A charged silence, then the line goes dead.  159 OMITTED 159

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large Chinese restaurant. We follow Driver through the He sees Bernie Rose sitting at a table on his own, pourin himself a glass of wine. The mobster's dressed for the oc wearing a jacket and tie. He smiles at Driver as he sits  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Care for a glass?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver doesn't smile, gazing back at him across the table Bernie Rose doesn't seem to care.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can recommend the duck. Hell, I can recommend everything -- Walnut prawns, shredded beef, Velvet chicken -- but the duck's to die for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He delivers the last line with a pointed smile, then turn calling over a WAITRESS.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The duck, please. For two.  WAITRESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else?  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thanks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waits for the waitress to leave, then turns back to Dr  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been on a roll. Cut yourself quite a swath out there.   (CONTINUED) 82 9/24/10 160 CONTINUED: 160  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never asked for any of it.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We usually don't. But it comes down on our heads regardless. Look at Shannon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver holds his gaze, the tension palpable, laughter and conversation drifting over from the other tables.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway it's water under the bridge now. Question is where does that leave us?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's up to you.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bring the cash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver nods. Bernie Rose studies him quietly.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me something, how does someone with no interest in money get mixed up in a heist? (Off his silence) Shannon told me it was because of the girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver hesitates, betraying a hint of concern. Bernie see and smiles.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. Nobody else knows about her. Just me... (A BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still see her?...  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not interested.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got her head screwed on right. I got two ex-wives, three kids, four grandchildren. Not one of them speaks to me now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles again, looking into Driver's eyes with just a h sympathy.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what I'll do for you. You give me the money, nobody knows she exists. But it's a different matter with you. (MORE)  (CONTINUED) 83 9/24/10 160 CONTINUED: (2) 160

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERNIE ROSE (cont'd) These people I have the misfortune to be involved with, they don't mind Nino being gone, but they'll wanna know what happened to him...  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like we have a problem...  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just when we were getting to know each other...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes are fixed on each other, deadly enemies but ki spirits of a kind.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...We shake hands, say goodbye, it's the start of your new life. Sooner or later they'll come after you. No end to it. Someone gets tired, somebody else takes their place. It goes on and on. Whatever dreams you have, whatever plans, you might as well forget `em, because this is what it's gonna be like till the day you die... (A BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just thought you should know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver stares back at him quietly.  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you suggest I do?  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First time I heard about you, Shannon told me you drove. Fast. That's a start...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps staring at Driver, then smiles.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either that or you choke on the duck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver's car is parked at the back of the parking lot, ha hidden by a fenced area for garbage. Driver pops the trun taking out the black gym bag with the cash. Bernie Rose d even look at it, still admiring the car.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much does something like this cost?  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine, ten thousand. If you can find one that still runs.  (CONTINUED) 84 9/24/10 161 CONTINUED: 161  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'll take yours. Part of our deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grins, then holds out his hand for the gym bag.  BERNIE ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
